bill_title: require notice and compensation prior to entry upon private land for the purpose of causing an examination and survey.

bill_versions.bill_text: An Act to require notice and compensation prior to entry upon private land for the purpose of causing an examination and survey. Be it enacted by the Legislature of the State of South Dakota: Section 1. That § 21-35-31 be AMENDED: 21-35-31. The provisions of thisThis section applies only apply to a project whichthat requires a siting permit pursuant to chapter 49-41B.Each A person vested with authority to take private property for public use may cause an a visual examination and a location and topographical survey to be made, as necessary, for its proposed facilities. The person or the person's agents and officers may enter the private property for the purpose of the examination and survey. Any person seeking to cause an examination or survey, where if permission for an examination or survey has been denied, shall: (1) Have filed a siting permit application with the Public Utilities Commission, pursuant to § 49-41B-11; (2) Give thirty days written notice, including the filing and expected dates of entry,Provide to the owner, and any tenant in possession of the private property, thirty days' written notice that complies with the service requirements set forth in § 15-6-4, and includes: (a) The anticipated date of entry; and (b) The name and contact information of the person, or the person's agent or officer, who will enter the property for the purpose of causing the examination and survey; and (3) Make a an initial payment to the owner, orin the amount of five hundred dollars, as compensation for entering the owner's property, and provide sufficient securityfor to ensure the payment, of additional compensation for any actual damage done to the property by the entry. This section does not apply to the state or its any political subdivisions subdivision of the state. This section is in addition to and not in derogation of any other existing law.
